abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of Port Cities
            Development Project for Yemen are to assist the Borrower to:
            (i) remove critical constraints to economic development; and
            (ii) improve the environment for investment and economic
            growth and development, within its port cities. The project
            was approved on January 23, 2003 as an adaptable program
            loan to be implemented in three phases to transform
            Yemen's three phases to transform Yemen's three
            cities into regional centers of economic growth, private
            sector manufacturing and services in Aden and Hodeidah, and
            tourism in Mukalla. The closing date of the project was
            extended by three years, from June 30, 2007 to June 30,
            2010. The project amount is currently US$26.12 million out
            of which US$24.372 has been disbursed (93 percent), while
            US$25.73 (98.5 percent) of the proceeds of the credit are
            committed, and the credit is expected to be fully disbursed
            by the end of the grace period - October 31, 2010. There are
            no changes to the project development objectives, outcomes,
            design and or scope of the project resulting from this
            reallocation. There are also no changes to the disbursement
            percentages of any of the categories of expenditure.
